Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a threat to freedom of speech, which is considered essential in a democratic society.
Misinformation and disinformation should not be restricted in the same way as hate speech.
There is concern over who will determine what constitutes misinformation or disinformation, suggesting it could be subjective or influenced by government directives.
The legislation could be abused by the government and its agencies.
The submitter believes that much misinformation has historically come from the government, its agencies, and mainstream media.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is an essential element of a democratic society.
One of my concerns is who is going to decide what is mis/disinformation.
I believe, if this undemocratic legislation is passed, it will be abused by the government and its agencies.
